items.q: As a discussion leader in a book club, I strive to nurture new members to help them become thoughtful readers. ____________________
My colleague and I go out for coffee together every Friday after work. ____________________
As a teacher, I feel it is important to assess learners frequently to make sure they are learning and retaining new knowledge. ____________________
Mark's hobby is preserving old photographs for his friends and family. ____________________
Going to regular physical therapy appointments played a vital role in Amy's recovery. ____________________
Laura's headaches are triggered by working long hours and drinking too much coffee. ____________________
Our entire community came together in support of the new recycling program. ____________________
We spent an enormous amount of time planning for our parents' fiftieth wedding anniversary. ____________________
I no longer ____________________ water for granted after living without indoor plumbing for a year.
____________________ than going to the movies, we decided to stay home and watch something on TV.
What made Tim's new job even ____________________ was that he had to commute one hour each way.
Emma decided to ____________________ abroad in Spain during her junior year of college.
The party was so noisy that we had to use gestures as a means of ____________________.
A vast ____________________ of athletes from our university go on to play sports professionally.
Our ____________________ employees receive a bonus after the first year of employment.
In my current financial ____________________, I really should not go out for dinner as frequently as I do.
(1) a. bad b. badly
(2) a. direct b. directly
(3) a. indirect b. indirectly
(4) a. convincing b. convincingly
(5) a. natural b. naturally
(6) a. logical b. logically
(7) a. reasonable b. reasonably
(8) a. tremendous b. tremendously
(9) a. positive b. positively
(10) a. neutral b. neutrally
(11) a. immediate b. immediately
(12) a. great b. greatly
Though Beethoven ____ be one of the most famous popular composers, he is not my favorite. a. may b. should c. had better
The health department ____ do something about all of the litter on the street. It cannot be healthy for residents. a. will b. should c. might
I ____ pull my car over to the side of the road for a few minutes because the rain was coming down so relentlessly. a. had better b. had to c. may
We ____ research this plan before we present it to our supervisor at next week's meeting. a. must b. will c. could
You ____ hurry if you don't want to be late for the show. a. had better b. could c. might
If you make dinner, I ____ wash the dishes. a. ought to b. may c. will
Sophia thinks she ____ pass the course if she got a tutor. a. has to b. had better c. could
They ____ lose their jobs if there is another recession. a. might b. have to c. must
Because of the excessively number of failing grades on the test, the professor felt he should review the last three units again. a. excessively b. failing c. should
Juan was hesitant to enter his boss's office, as he feared he ought to receive troubling news about his next assignment. a. hesitant b. ought to c. troubling
The list of guests had gotten so incredible long that we could invite only our dearest friends but not our casua l acquaintances. a. incredible b. could c. casual
Diane hardly watches television anymore, as she might no longer abide the seemingly endless number of commercials interrupting her favorite programs. a. hardly b. might c. seemingly
The last job applicant could probably not be hired on account of his being poorly dressed and disheveled. a. could b. probably c. poorly
deplete
solution
allow
abroad
delete
shut down
downplay
complex
unique
affordable
Although many of Jane's competitors faced problems attracting new customers, her business was flourishing. __________
The school is providing healthier lunches for the students; conversely, fresh fruit is now served instead of canned fruit. __________
The flowers in our garden are in full bloom likewise the lack of rain this spring. __________
Cycling to work is often quicker than driving; furthermore, it's good exercise. __________
The pasta dishes served at the new Italian restaurant aren't very flavorful; moreover, the desserts are fantastic. __________
The Death Penalty: Effective, or Not? __________
Do Cell Phones Really Improve Communication? __________
Great Tips on How to Train Your Dog __________
Should We Ban Cars from Cities? __________
Vacationing in the Caribbean __________
Should children be required to learn a second language? Use modals in your argument essay.
